choices.E: Utilize a USB VGA graphics adapter.
choices.F: Adjust the keystone settings on the projector.

questions.question_text:
A technician is setting up a laptop and projector for a presentation. When plugging in the projector, it mirrors the desktop screen from the laptop, but everything appears distorted and compressed.
Which of the following should the technician do to correct the appearance of the image on the projector?

discussion.content:
as per Professor Messer Notes: subdomain 5.4 - Troubleshooting Video and Display Issues:

Distorted image and geometry:
• Check the OS refresh rate and resolution settings
• Need to match the display specifications
Could scaling be a problem?

This is a definetly mutli choice question, so I would say "C" if correcrt, is not the only answer. I would say "A- Update the laptops graphics driver" is a correct answer too as it would solve distorted images.

comments.content: I don't think that updating drivers will arrange anything, as resolution still need to be adjusted after the update.
Yes, it absolutely does. That's why native resolutions exist.
F is really used for when the projector and the screen are at an angle from one another.

discussion.content: I think the right answer is F. Resolution has nothing to do with image distortion.

comments.content: I think the keyword is "mirror" because it mirror the desktop sometimes the resolution is not right for projector. So you want the resolution on both device is the same.

The desktop is the main screen area that you see after you turn on your computer and log on to Windows. Like the top of an actual desk, it serves as a surface for your work. When you open programs or folders, they appear on the desktop. They are referring to the Desktop in Windows not a Desktop Computer in general. Poorly worded question/answer.

discussion.content:
I don't understand this answer. It says laptop/projector combination so how is the answer "desktop"

wouldn't B make more sense?

I am the newbie here, but I just wanted to confirm that the answer is A (iaas). According to Microsoft: " The public cloud is defined as computing services offered by third-party providers over the public Internet, making them available to anyone who wants to use or purchase them. They may be free or sold on-demand, allowing customers to pay only per usage for the CPU cycles, storage, or bandwidth they consume." So the answer is A (iaas) because we are using the provider's infrastructure as far as servers, virtual machines, etc. On the other hand, saas will be more like using Gmail or Microsoft Outlook. I hope that helps.
VM's are IAAS (Infrastructure as a service) because on a VM you can manage what operation system runs and what software is installed.

it is A iaas
See Microsoft webiste https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/infrastructure-as-a-service-series-virtual-machines-and-windows/
We recently announced the release of Windows Azure Virtual Machines, an Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) offering in Windows Azure.
IaaS FOR set up a virtual machine in a public cloud environment.
why is the answer saas? i need help

comments.content: SaaS is a software as a service, example of that is the google calendar, dropbox, etc... IaaS is infrastructure as a service, meaning your company severs, vm, etc.. can be in the cloud without your company worrying about the hardwares.

questions.question_text:
A technician wants to set up a virtual machine in a public cloud environment.
Which of the following cloud models should the technician use?

choices.C: Create a VLAN for all employees updating social media.
choices.A: Enable QoS on network traffic, prioritizing telecast traffic over uploads.
choices.D: Adjust the network intrusion device to allow video to flow without filtering.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
QoS QoS allows administrators to prioritize certain network traffi c by assigning a higher
priority to it. Higher priority traffi c may come from a specifi c server or specifi c application.
This is used a lot with Voice over IP (VoIP)—telephone calls over a computer network—to
ensure that the voice data gets through and the connection doesn’t sound garbled.
a configuring Quality of service is the answer

Configuring Quality of Service is the most correct answer to prioritize video traffic.
Upgrading video equipment is inappropriate as there is no reported issue with video quality itself, only playback to viewers.
Creating a separate VLAN is inappropriate because this does not change the outbound traffic volume; buffering can still be expected.
Adjusting the NIDS to allow for unfiltered traffic invites a security vulnerability, and is therefore an inappropriate response.

questions.question_text:
A corporation maintains an active social media presence by constantly uploading audio and video. The corporation also regularly hosts video conferences, but attendees are reporting buffering during their telecast.
Which of the following should the IT department do to improve the ability to attend video conferences without interruption?

discussion.content:
Molex is the most correct answer. P4 connectors are commonly associated with internal power cables from the PSU. These power other systems like graphics cards and CPU fans.
24-pin connectors are often dedicated in their entirety to provide 12V, but do not otherwise end in a P4 connector.
SCSI cables do not employ P4 connectors; often SCSI inputs are built into the motherboard or expansion card.
eSATA provides its own 5V or 12V power to its devices in addition to data transfer, but do not use P4 connectors.

Selected Answer: B
From Mike Meyers: "P4 power connector: Provides additional 12-volt power to assist the 20/24-pin P1 motherboard power connector."
Don't argue with THE man

This exact question h different choices on certbrary omg the answer is A on their site 
Which of the following has a P4 connector to provide a 12V output?
A. EIDE port
B. 24-pin adapter
C. SCSI cable
D. eSATA cable

Selected Answer: B
Molex is a company that makes a variety of connectors. The P4 was added to the 20 pin connector to make the 24 pin. Molex also makes the older power connectors for IDE drives, fans, etc. Those are also 12v.

P4 means the 4 pin square Pentium 4 connector that is part of the 24 pin atx power connector, most are 20 + 4 meaning the P4 is able to be used with the 20 pin to make a 24 pin connector or just use the 20 pin on its own if not using a Pentium 4 Processor... "On a 20+4 Pin connector, four of the pins are on a separate block making it reverse compatible with the older motherboards that require only a 20 pin connector."
Source: http://support.antec.com/support/solutions/articles/1000140052-what-is-this-connector-for-

comments.content: In other words- the question asks "which of the following HAS a P4 connector?" Only a 2-piece, 24 pin atx power supply adapter has a P4 connector in addition to the other 20 pin connector- thereby making it a 24 pin adapter
This. Even I originally read it as "Which one IS a P4 connector", when the key word is "HAS".

discussion.content: P4 connector stands for Pentium 4 connector. Molex is an older standard, and is not really a P4 connector per se. However, Molex is the closest answer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following has a P4 connector to provide a 12V output?

A systems administrator wants to take advantage of the benefits of the major cloud providers while retaining some data and services in the local datacenter.
Which of the following types of cloud model should the administrator consider?

discussion.content: Keyword "while" meaning two things going on. I automatically assumed hybrid.
